name: Tarot Mythology
tagline: The Fool's Journey and Archetypal Wisdom
description: Journey through the Major Arcana's archetypal path from Fool to World, mapping spiritual initiation and inner transformation.
overview: Tarot mythology synthesizes Western esoteric traditions (Kabbalah, astrology, alchemy, Hermeticism) into 78 archetypal symbols. The 22 Major Arcana represent the Fool's Journey - a spiritual initiation from innocence through trials to enlightenment. Cards embody universal human experiences and psychological states. Tarot connects to: Kabbalistic Tree of Life (22 paths between 10 sefirot), astrological correspondences, four elements (suits), and Hero's Journey structure. Modern interpretation emphasizes psychological insight, synchronicity, and intuitive wisdom rather than fortune-telling.

culturalContext.primarySources: Waite-Smith deck, Thoth deck, historical decks, esoteric texts

sections.title: The Fool's Journey
sections.body:
**0 - The Fool:** Innocence, new beginnings, leap of faith
**I - The Magician:** Willpower, manifestation, "As above, so below"
**II - High Priestess:** Intuition, mystery, hidden knowledge
**III - Empress:** Abundance, motherhood, nature
**IV - Emperor:** Authority, structure, fatherhood
...
**XXI - The World:** Completion, integration, cosmic dance

The journey maps spiritual development from naive potential through experiences and trials to wholeness and self-realization.
